intro: Overview of Panama’s community access programs, nationwide free Wi-Fi, and digital government agenda, with key milestones, metrics, and policies.

community_access_programs.title: Infoplazas (Community Internet Centers)
community_access_programs.summary: Physical community centers that provide public internet access, digital skills training, and e-services support across all provinces and several comarcas.

timeline.event: Program established under SENACYT (early deployments throughout the 2000s).
Official list shows at least 222 active Infoplazas (mid-year snapshot).
Infoplazas AIP continues expansion and partnerships (e.g., universities, municipalities).

impact: Expanded access for rural and urban communities
Free or very low-cost connectivity and training

community_access_programs.title: Red Nacional de Internet (Internet Para Todos)
community_access_programs.summary: Nationwide free public Wi-Fi program operated by AIG. RNI 2.0 increases coverage and capacity to enable access to state digital services.

timeline.event: Launch of Internet Para Todos (RNI) as a free Wi-Fi network.
Infoplazas and RNI integrated into broader digital inclusion push.
Program modernization and continued expansion via RNI 2.0.

open_data.dataset_name: AIG – Data transferida de la Red Nacional Internet (Internet Para Todos)

institutional_milestones.event: Creation of the Secretaría de la Presidencia para la Innovación Gubernamental (SIG) by Executive Decree 102.
Establishment of the Autoridad Nacional para la Innovación Gubernamental (AIG) by Law 65.
AIG regulation issued by Executive Decree 205.
E-Government Law (Law 83) mandates digital agendas and regulates online procedures.

flagship_platforms.name: Panamá en Línea (Trámites en línea)
flagship_platforms.purpose: Single window for online procedures and payments; supports interoperability and digital signatures.

flagship_platforms.name: Centro de Atención Ciudadana 311
flagship_platforms.purpose: Omnichannel citizen service desk assisting with government services and online procedures.

flagship_platforms.name: Datos Abiertos
flagship_platforms.purpose: Open data portal for government datasets (e.g., RNI usage).

flagship_platforms.name: Municipios Digitales
flagship_platforms.purpose: Local government digital services and modernization initiatives coordinated by AIG.

strategic_agendas_and_plans.name: Plan Estratégico de Banda Ancha (PEBA)
highlights: Guides broadband expansion, inclusion, and service quality
Supports open government and citizen-centric services

strategic_agendas_and_plans.name: Agenda Digital Estratégica (Panamá 4.0)
highlights: Interoperability, simplification of procedures, and shared platforms
Grounded in Law 83 (2012) and aligned with national plans

strategic_agendas_and_plans.name: Agenda Digital / Hoja de Ruta AIG
highlights: Successive agendas (2020, 2021, 2022) and a 2025 Roadmap continue expansion of coverage, cybersecurity, data governance and interoperability

strategic_agendas_and_plans.name: Sectoral Digital Strategies toward 2030
highlights: Digital Health Strategy 2024–2030 under MINSA with PAHO support
National STI policy references Industry 4.0, including AI and IoT enablement
